head.supplied: ¶ [Suggests that copies of his report on the Forest Resources of Western Australia ¶ B79.13.10. ¶ ¶ be sent to certain individuals. for a few copies for his own use.] ¶ W. Odgers to M, 20 December 1...

div.p: No. 11243, vol. 1879 P, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Letter not found; item is a register entry only, dated 8 December 1879. Q5887
[Suggests that copies of his report on the Forest Resources of Western Australia
B79.13.10.
be sent to certain individuals. for a few copies for his own use.]
W. Odgers to M, 20 December 1879 (in this edition as 79-12-20a) reported that the volumes had not yet arrived. When the 50 copies from the WA Government did arrive, M was sent 25 copies for his own use (W. Odgers to M, 15 January 1880) as suggested by the WA Government in November 1879 (see notes to M to J. Forrest, 11 September 1879). In M to G. Berry, 19 January 1880 (in this edition as 80.01.19a) M inquired whether the Governor and Government ministers would receive a copy, presumably from the remaining 25 copies that the WA Government had sent to Victoria.
My notes say next file is Q11845 but I don’t say what this is about. Presumably letter from Western Australia transmitting copies of report. Might be a LNF also. Check PRO. Then next letter is
See M to Chief Secretary, 19 January 1880. S735.
There seems to be more on this topic. See transcribers/initial editing notes with 80-01-19a:
"Andy’s notes indicate there are several subsequent letters on this subject – R787, S824, S1091, S2996, R4938, R7149, and some toings and froings between CS and Lands. These numbers should be checked to see if any are M letters or letters that should be cited in notes to this one. Also Andy ultimately couldn’t work out how the file was disposed of – this needs to be checked again. It could be in lands (i.e. lost) but it looks to be about one of M’s books so is worth pursuing"
I could not find these items in the corpus, but see80-07-17suggesting a copy went to the Sec State Colonies.If a copy was sent to the Sec State it is not now in the KCL Special collections which houses the historic Foreign Office and Colonial Office library, but there is a copy of the 1882 volume which includes this item at KCLManchester has the equivalent pamphlet collection.
